commit_message:
Add functional test for deleting a compute service

This adds a functional test which asserts the things
related to bug 1756179 where deleting a compute service
does not also delete the related host mapping or resource
provider resources.

Also related to bug 1763183 in that it should not be
possible to delete a compute service that has instances
running on it since that will mess up resource tracking
in Placement.

Change-Id: I519c5abfe24b154998f481c8a86db239a75d4729
Related-Bug: #1756179
Related-Bug: #1763183
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/26/560626/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import context as nova_context from nova import objects from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers from nova.tests.unit.image import fake as image_fake from nova.tests.unit import policy_fixture from nova.virt import fake from nova import rc_fields class TestServicesAPI(test.TestCase, integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin): def setUp(self): super(TestServicesAPI, self).setUp() self.useFixture(policy_fixture.RealPolicyFixture()) # The NeutronFixture is needed to stub out validate_networks in API. self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.NeutronFixture(self)) # We need the computes reporting into placement for the filter # scheduler to pick a host. self.placement_api = self.useFixture( nova_fixtures.PlacementFixture()).api api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')) # The admin API is used to work with the os-services API. self.admin_api = api_fixture.admin_api self.api = api_fixture.api # Register some fake images. image_fake.stub_out_image_service(self) self.addCleanup(image_fake.FakeImageService_reset) self.start_service('conductor') # We have to get the image before we use 2.latest otherwise we'll get # a 404 on the /images proxy API because of 2.36. self.image_id = self.api.get_images()[0]['id'] # Use the latest microversion available to make sure something does # not regress in new microversions; cap as necessary. self.admin_api.microversion = 'latest' self.api.microversion = 'latest' # The consoleauth service is needed for deleting console tokens when # the server is deleted. self.start_service('consoleauth') self.start_service('scheduler') # Create our single compute service. fake.set_nodes(['host1']) self.addCleanup(fake.restore_nodes) self.compute = self.start_service('compute') def test_compute_service_delete_ensure_related_cleanup(self): """Tests deleting a compute service and the related cleanup associated with that like the compute_nodes table entry and removing the host from any aggregates. """ # Make sure our compute host is represented as expected. services = self.admin_api.get_services(binary='nova-compute') self.assertEqual(1, len(services)) service = services[0] # Now create a host aggregate and add our host to it. aggregate = self.admin_api.post_aggregate( {'aggregate': {'name': 'agg1'}}) self.admin_api.add_host_to_aggregate(aggregate['id'], service['host']) # Make sure the host is in the aggregate. aggregate = self.admin_api.api_get( '/os-aggregates/%s' % aggregate['id']).body['aggregate'] self.assertEqual([service['host']], aggregate['hosts']) # Make sure there is a compute node record by querying the # os-hypervisors API. hypervisors = self.admin_api.api_get( '/os-hypervisors').body['hypervisors'] self.assertEqual(1, len(hypervisors)) hypervisor = hypervisors[0] # Remember that hypervisor['id'] is the UUID starting with 2.53. rp_uuid = hypervisor['id'] # We'll know there is a host mapping implicitly if os-hypervisors # returned something, but let's also make sure the host mapping is # there like we expect. ctxt = nova_context.get_admin_context() objects.HostMapping.get_by_host(ctxt, service['host']) # Make sure there is a resource provider for that compute node based # on the uuid. resp = self.placement_api.get('/resource_providers/%s' % rp_uuid) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status) # Make sure the resource provider has inventory. inventories = self.placement_api.get( '/resource_providers/%s/inventories' % rp_uuid).body['inventories'] # Expect a minimal set of inventory for the fake virt driver. for resource_class in [rc_fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, rc_fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, rc_fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB]: self.assertIn(resource_class, inventories) # Now create a server so that the resource provider has some allocation # records. server = self._build_minimal_create_server_request( self.api, 'test_compute_service_delete_ensure_related_cleanup', image_uuid=self.image_id, networks='none') server = self.api.post_server({'server': server}) server = self._wait_for_state_change(self.api, server, 'ACTIVE') # Assert the allocations for the instance are against our compute node # resource provider and for the flavor used for the instance. allocations = self.placement_api.get( '/allocations/%s' % server['id']).body['allocations'] self.assertIn(rp_uuid, allocations) allocations = allocations[rp_uuid] expected_resources = { rc_fields.ResourceClass.VCPU: server['flavor']['vcpus'], rc_fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB: server['flavor']['ram'], rc_fields.ResourceClass.DISK_GB: server['flavor']['disk'] } self.assertDictEqual(expected_resources, allocations['resources']) # Now the fun part, delete the compute service and make sure related # resources are cleaned up, like the compute node, host mapping, and # resource provider. We have to first stop the compute service so # it doesn't recreate the compute node during the # update_available_resource periodic task. self.compute.stop() self.admin_api.api_delete('/os-services/%s' % service['id']) # Make sure the service is deleted. services = self.admin_api.get_services(binary='nova-compute') self.assertEqual(0, len(services)) # Make sure the host was removed from the aggregate. aggregate = self.admin_api.api_get( '/os-aggregates/%s' % aggregate['id']).body['aggregate'] self.assertEqual([], aggregate['hosts']) # Trying to show the hypervisor details should result in a 404. self.admin_api.api_get('/os-hypervisors/%s' % hypervisor['id'], check_response_status=[404]) # FIXME(mriedem): This is bug 1756179 where the host mapping is not # deleted. Once the bug is fixed, we should be able to change this # to assert that HostMappingNotFound is raised. objects.HostMapping.get_by_host(ctxt, service['host']) # FIXME(mriedem): This is bug 1756179 where the compute node resource # provider is not deleted. Once the bug is fixed, this should result # in a 404 response. resp = self.placement_api.get('/resource_providers/%s' % rp_uuid) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status)

commit_message:
Add generation checking logic to Consumer

This patch adds the logic to the Consumer object to check that the
requested_generation value matches the value in the database. For now it
will do nothing, but when a new microversion is added, it will raise a
ConcurrentUpdateDetected exception.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: I35125ec23788b65f52f8e120d8de2c7c32afec83
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/08/561408/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'consumer_generation': fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), # If project_id and user_id are not set then skip this call. # This allows microversion <1.8 to continue to work. Those # fields are required in later microversions and the # enforcement is at the HTTP API layer. if ('project_id' in alloc and alloc.project_id is not None and 'user_id' in alloc and alloc.user_id is not None): # The consumer_generation field may not have been set by # older code. if "consumer_generation" in alloc: consumer_generation = alloc.consumer_generation else: consumer_generation = None Consumer.ensure_consumer(context, consumer_id, alloc.project_id, alloc.user_id, consumer_generation) "request_generation": fields.IntegerField(nullable=True), # By default, this is False to maintain the behavior for microversions # before 1.xx. Newer microversions will set this to True, which will # check that the request supplied a consumer_generation that matches # the value in the database. A failed match indicates a race condition, # and a ConcurrentUpdateDetected will be raised. "enforce_generation": fields.BooleanField(default=False), dict_res["enforce_generation"] = False self.validate_generation() def validate_generation(self): if not self.enforce_generation: return True # Valid combinations are new consumers, with a generation of -1, and a # request with a None generation, or a matching generation and # request_generation . valid = ((self.generation == -1 and self.request_generation is None) or (self.generation == self.request_generation)) if not valid: # TODO(edleafe): Uncomment the next line when the microversion is # raised to support this behavior. # raise ConcurrentUpdateDetected() return False return True
deleted_lines: alloc.ensure_consumer_project_user(context) "request_generation": fields.IntegerField(nullable=True) # TODO(edleafe): Add the logic for generation conflicts

subject: Granular: group_policy={none|isolate}
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-19 15:28:50.000000000', 'files': ['specs/rocky/approved/granular-resource-requests.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/cfbfa180824c94d44d7389445c3af86de9b28d37', 'message': 'Granular: group_policy={none|isolate}

After much discussion [1], we have agreed to implement both
"anti-affinity" and "any fit" in the granular request syntax by
requiring a `group_policy` queryparam when more than one numbered
request group is specified.  The queryparam may have one of two values:

`isolate`: Different numbered request groups will be satisfied by
different providers (forced anti-affinity).

`none`: Different numbered request groups may be satisfied by different
providers or common providers ("any fit").

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129477.html

Change-Id: I116089b2d4f3faeb985329fd33507ece9e9ca944
'}]
commit_message:
Granular: group_policy={none|isolate}

After much discussion [1], we have agreed to implement both
"anti-affinity" and "any fit" in the granular request syntax by
requiring a `group_policy` queryparam when more than one numbered
request group is specified.  The queryparam may have one of two values:

`isolate`: Different numbered request groups will be satisfied by
different providers (forced anti-affinity).

`none`: Different numbered request groups may be satisfied by different
providers or common providers ("any fit").

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129477.html

Change-Id: I116089b2d4f3faeb985329fd33507ece9e9ca944
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/87/562687/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from the *same* resource provider (affinity). * _`Requirement 3`: Ensuring that requests of certain resources are allocated from *different* resource providers (anti-affinity). * _`Requirement 4`: The ability to spread allocations of effectively-identical saturation ("any fit").In a high-availability scenario, request **two VFs on NET1 from different PFs.** Expect: * ``[RP1(SRIOV_NET_VF:1), RP3(SRIOV_NET_VF:1)]`` But **not** either of: * ``[RP1(SRIOV_NET_VF:2)]`` * ``[RP3(SRIOV_NET_VF:2)]`` This demonstrates `Requirement 3`_. Use Case 5 ~~~~~~~~~~This demonstrates `Requirement 4`_. group_policy = "none"|"isolate" * With ``group_policy=none``, separate groups (numbered or un-numbered) may return results from different RPs *or* the same RP (assuming isolation is not otherwise forced e.g. via traits or inventory/usage constraints). * With ``group_policy=isolate``, numbered request groups are guaranteed to be satisfied by *separate* RPs. This applies only to numbered request groups. That is, resources within the un-numbered group are still able to be provided by any RPs in the tree (or aggregate); and there is no restriction between the RPs satisfied by the un-numbered group and those satisfied by the numbered groups. * The ``group_policy`` option is **required** when more than one numbered group is specified; omitting it will result in a 400 error. numbered groups. This satisfies `Requirement 4`_.Specify inter-group affinity policy via the ``group_policy`` key, which may have the following values: * ``isolate``: Different numbered request groups will be satisfied by *different* providers. * ``none``: Different numbered request groups may be satisfied by different providers *or* common providers. group_policy=isolatevia the number being appended to the ``resources`` and ``required`` keywords, and require a ``group_policy`` to be specified when more than one numbered grouping is given. In the following example, groups 1 and 2 represent `Use Case 3`_:: &group_policy=none The following example demonstrates the use of ``group_policy=isolate`` and represents `Use Case 4`_ by ensuring that the two VFs come from different providers, even though they are otherwise identical:: GET /allocation_candidates ?resources1=SRIOV_NET_VF:1 &required1=CUSTOM_PHYSNET_NET1 &resources2=SRIOV_NET_VF:1 &required2=CUSTOM_PHYSNET_NET1 &group_policy=isolate* Much discussion has occurred around whether and how to satisfy both anti-affinity (`Requirement 3`_) and "any fit" (`Requirement 4`_). See the `separate_providers proposal`_, the `can_split proposal`_, and the `mailing list thread`_ for details... _`separate_providers proposal`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561717/ .. _`can_split proposal`: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560974/ .. _`mailing list thread`: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129477.html
deleted_lines: from the same resource provider. * _`Requirement 3`: The ability to spread allocations of effectively-identical saturation.This demonstrates `Requirement 3`_.* Separate groups (numbered or un-numbered) may return results from the same RP. That is, you are not guaranteeing RP exclusivity by separating groups. (If you want to guarantee such exclusivity, you need to do it with traits.) numbered groups. This satisfies `Requirement 3`_.via the number being appended to the ``resources`` and ``required`` keywords. In the following example, groups 1 and 2 represent `Use Case 3`_::* It has been suggested to include (or at least keep the way open for) syntax that would allow the user to express (anti-)affinity of resources. The change proposed by this spec leaves a small niche of affinity-related use cases unsatisfied. The scope and exact form of, and real-world need for, these use cases is poorly understood at this time, and is therefore not addressed by this specification.

subject: Delete allocations from API if nova-compute is down
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 01:38:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e078a088b73942c49640e610b4462be422399eaa', 'message': 'Delete allocations from API if nova-compute is down

When performing a "local delete" of an instance, we
need to delete the allocations that the instance has
against any resource providers in Placement.

It should be noted that without this change, restarting
the nova-compute service will delete the allocations
for it's compute node (assuming the compute node UUID
is the same as before the instance was deleted). That
is shown in the existing functional test modified here.

not configured thanks for the @safe_connect decorator
used in SchedulerReportClient.

commit_message:
Delete allocations from API if nova-compute is down

When performing a "local delete" of an instance, we
need to delete the allocations that the instance has
against any resource providers in Placement.

It should be noted that without this change, restarting
the nova-compute service will delete the allocations
for its compute node (assuming the compute node UUID
is the same as before the instance was deleted). That
is shown in the existing functional test modified here.

The more important reason for this change is that in
order to fix bug 1756179, we need to make sure the
resource provider allocations for a given compute node
are gone by the time the compute service is deleted.

This adds a new functional test and a release note for
the new behavior and need to configure nova-api for
talking to placement, which is idempotent if
not configured thanks to the @safe_connect decorator
used in SchedulerReportClient.

Closes-Bug: #1679750
Related-Bug: #1756179

Change-Id: If507e23f0b7e5fa417041c3870d77786498f741d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/560706/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova.scheduler.client import report as reportclient self.placementclient = reportclient.SchedulerReportClient() # Cleanup allocations in Placement since we can't do it from the # compute service. self.placementclient.delete_allocation_for_instance( context, instance.uuid)

commit_message:
Split up neutron-lbaas service plugin and agent

Splitting up service plugin and agent allows operators to deploy
neutron-lbaas with greater granularity over what one wants to get
installed configured. For example, one may want to configure only one of
the two.

Change-Id: If3af333b34d2af764d111d49e981f9d3a170d803

commit_message:
Downloads amphora images from artifact storage

This will download a test amphora image per default form the
Open Stack artifact storage to speed up tests. Operators can
configure their won artifact storage to simplify deploys.

Change-Id: I408d4128d35aab889dbe89fd9497d83a7830129b

commit_message:
config download support for a fixed directory

Makes config download write directly to the directory specified by
 --config-dir, instead of a tmpdir underneath that location.
This change also breaks Config.download_config tasks into unique
funtions to support accessing directory creation functionality
independently from config retrieval and playbook creation.

Change-Id: Ie00f71b12f56262985c47810be0e80402e9e558e
Depends-On: Ibb59b044dc0c14bf48dc3d500536195230414c81
Depends-On: Icbd6dd65893f785b7ca8edf2eab46dbc7492e050
Closes-Bug: 1752118
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/77/550577/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - ``openstack overcloud config download`` now writes directly to the directory specified by ``--config-dir``, and will overwrite files on subsequent runs to the same ``--config-dir`` location. Tmpdirs are no longer used.

subject: Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-20 09:51:53.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/workflow/lookup_utils.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'mistral/workflow/direct_workflow.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/afabe92cf5f6feb4e72c7a83a16b11521c85b769', 'message': 'Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request

* Evaluation of the final workflow context was an extremely
  memory expensive operation in case if we had a lot of task
  executions (which are last in their branches) to process
  and their inbound context were big (at least a few MB each).
  Mistral had to fetch the entire collection of completed
  tasks in order to do all required processing.
  This patch addresses this problem by using a batch query
  approach in conjunction with python generators that allow
  GC to destroy bathes of task executions that have already
  been processed.
  According to the tests (based on test_big_on_closures in
  test_direct_workflow.py module) memory footprint is reduced
  by 3 times (from 1.5 GB to 0.5 GB when the number of tasks is
  500 and each inbound context has 40000 entries) whereas the
  total test run time increased only by ~1%.

Change-Id: I1f016a9c0d3add35e2c5059a29a2eca00e45af42
(cherry picked from commit 62d1003ee0b78eb610dac1632d303e51f8c3932f)
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request

* Evaluation of the final workflow context was an extremely
  memory expensive operation in case if we had a lot of task
  executions (which are last in their branches) to process
  and their inbound context were big (at least a few MB each).
  Mistral had to fetch the entire collection of completed
  tasks in order to do all required processing.
  This patch addresses this problem by using a batch query
  approach in conjunction with python generators that allow
  GC to destroy bathes of task executions that have already
  been processed.
  According to the tests (based on test_big_on_closures in
  test_direct_workflow.py module) memory footprint is reduced
  by 3 times (from 1.5 GB to 0.5 GB when the number of tasks is
  500 and each inbound context has 40000 entries) whereas the
  total test run time increased only by ~1%.

Change-Id: I1f016a9c0d3add35e2c5059a29a2eca00e45af42
(cherry picked from commit 62d1003ee0b78eb610dac1632d303e51f8c3932f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/14/563014/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for batch in self._find_end_task_executions_as_batches(): if not batch: break for t_ex in batch: ctx = utils.merge_dicts( ctx, data_flow.evaluate_task_outbound_context(t_ex) ) def _find_end_task_executions_as_batches(self): batches = lookup_utils.find_completed_task_executions_as_batches( self.wf_ex.id for batch in batches: yield list( filter(is_end_task, batch) )
deleted_lines: for t_ex in self._find_end_task_executions(): ctx = utils.merge_dicts( ctx, data_flow.evaluate_task_outbound_context(t_ex) ) def _find_end_task_executions(self): return list( filter( is_end_task, lookup_utils.find_completed_task_executions(self.wf_ex.id) )

commit_message:
Enable BuildRequires repository in DLRN for master

Since Rocky, RDO is spliting dependencies repo in two different
repos, one for runtime requirement with the URL used in previous
releases and a new one with the packages that are only required
to build packages. This repo is not needed to deploy RDO but it's
needed to build packages with DLRN.

This patch is enabling the BuildRequires repository in DLRN
buildroot when running it in TripleO-CI when the repo is
defined.

Depends-On: I74388434e3dccfea2754569a6bc568835d49b5e2
Change-Id: I4d14d1328578edf489f6560f369142cd845591aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/84/561484/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Build Requires repo must be enabled only for dlrn build tasks, not in deployment if [ -f /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean*build-deps.repo ]; then sed -i 's/enabled=.*/enabled=1/g' /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean*build-deps.repo fi # Build Requires repo must be enabled only for dlrn build tasks, not in deployment if [ -f /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean*build-deps.repo ]; then sed -i 's/enabled=.*/enabled=0/g' /etc/yum.repos.d/delorean*build-deps.repo fi

Add `update converge` CLI to remove no-ops

The no-opped DeploymentSteps need to be re-added after we're done with
minor update.

commit_message:
Add ffwd-upgrade cli - overcloud ffwd-upgrade [prepare|run|converge]

Working with the sequence described in [0] with this patch and
the tripleo-common review in dependency below the operator can do:

    1 openstack overcloud ffwd-upgrade prepare ... $params
    # ^^^ added here, stack update for playbook generation.

    2 openstack overcloud ffwd-upgrade run ... $params
    # ^^^ added here. run fast_forward_upgrade_playbook.yaml
    # against the overcloud (don't expost limit_hosts)

    3 openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles Controller
    # ^^^ exists... runs the upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml and
    # deploy_steps_playbook.yaml and
    # post_upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml. Repeat 3. with all --roles

    4 openstack overcloud ffwd-upgrade converge
    # ^^^ added here. no stack update, just unset noop from plan

Co-Authored-By: Lukas Bezdicka <social@v3.sk>
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1561178#c0

(cherry picked from commit 78cf0c495d7ee704b9523e0ae5738602d029c264)
Change-Id: Ie7823e121a4fa57feb1c56bd4d58f3183e41b8d7

commit_message:
libvirt: log vm and task state when vif plugging times out

This enhances the warning we log when we timeout waiting
for the network-vif-plugged event from Neutron. It includes
the vm_state and task_state for context on the instance operation
since this is done for more than just the initial create, it's
also for things like rebuild.

The explicit instance uuid is also removed from the message since
sending the instance kwarg to LOG.warning logs the instance uuid
automatically. And _LW is also dropped since we no longer translate
log messages.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict is the result of _LW being required in Ocata.

Change-Id: I6daf1569cba2cfcb4e8da0b46c91d5251c9c6740
Related-Bug: #1694371
(cherry picked from commit 82ecd93a20f580a3bbec96bf570f2fcc1dc99f33)

"in-use", attached to the server which is now in "error" state.

They can delete the server, which then leaves the volume apparently

when the creation fails, compute manager detaches the created volumes
before putting the VM into error state. Then you can delete the instance

commit_message:
Detach volumes when VM creation fails

If the boot-volume creation fails, the data volume is left in state
"in-use", attached to the server which is now in "error" state.
The user can't detach the volume because of the server's error state.

They can delete the server, which then leaves the volume apparently
attached to a server that no longer exists, which is being fixed
separately: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340614/

The only way out of this is to ask an administrator to reset the state of
the data volume (this option is not available to regular users by
default policy).

This change fixes the problem in the compute service such that
when the creation fails, compute manager detaches the created volumes
before putting the VM into error state. Then you can delete the instance
without care about attached volumes.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict in _delete_instance is due to restructuring
the method in I9269ffa2b80e48db96c622d0dc0817738854f602 in Pike. Also
note that _LW has to be used for the warning message since those
translation markers are still required in Ocata.

Change-Id: I8b1c05317734e14ea73dc868941351bb31210bf0
Closes-bug: #1633249
(cherry picked from commit 61f6751a1807d3c3ee76d0351d17a82c6e1a915a)
(cherry picked from commit 22164d5118ea04321432432d89877aae91097e81)
(cherry picked from commit 4dbe72f976a67d442fd0e0489cadc3bc605ed012)

commit_message:
Add custom subclass to revert mapping

To be able to revert the custom mappings down by config-download, let's
add some tripleo specific subclasses which will be available in the
registry.

Change-Id: I6bd4107e8e1a6a9abc38d2dca7a91a6823f8b6c2
Related-Bug: #1758065
(cherry picked from commit 556325cc8cb1032194c2d3739f303fe0a4cfa1a4)

subject: [NEWTON ONLY] Adjust NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover to new default.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-12 10:27:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/5179adeec986b322f0fc29ec5beee5ffbe0aee94', 'message': "[NEWTON ONLY] Fix lost of fip connectivity after upgrade.

Neutron uses the host parameter to identify its agent.  In newton we
explicitly set this to $fqdn while we were using the default before.
The default was the value of socket.gethostname.  Depending on the
system configuration that could return fqdn or hostname.

That means that when it was returning hostname, we simply change the
host id.  The previous l3 agents get lost and all fip have
disappeared.

A solution here is to make sure that the new agents take over the fip
by setting NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover to True.

This has the added benefit of adjusting Mitaka's value of that
parameter (which was false *and* saved into the registry) to the new
newton default value (which is true)

Change-Id: Ibba351ff625abfe8fd5b1f76b9a49bac120cbd8a
Closes-Bug: #1763322
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-04-18 13:43:34.000000000', 'files': ['environments/major-upgrade-pacemaker-converge.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/85b489bf4fcfc8a19a82e4d713d0adde25463a9c', 'message': "[NEWTON ONLY] Adjust NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover to new default.

The default value of default NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover has changed
to true.  But in Mitaka that was set to false in the registry.  So
that value persists and overrides the new default.

This has no impact currently as this value is ignored neutron as the
l3 agents are in HA configuration (this parameter only work when
non-HA).

But, it's still good to have for two reasons:

 - it simplifies recovery if we hit bug #1763322, see[1]
 - it will not cause unexpected issue if we offer the possibility to
   have non-HA l3 agent.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/attachment.cgi?id=1421308

Change-Id: Ibba351ff625abfe8fd5b1f76b9a49bac120cbd8a
Related-Bug: #1763322
"}]
commit_message:
[NEWTON ONLY] Adjust NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover to new default.

The default value of default NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover has changed
to true.  But in Mitaka that was set to false in the registry.  So
that value persists and overrides the new default.

This has no impact currently as this value is ignored neutron as the
l3 agents are in HA configuration (this parameter only work when
non-HA).

But, it's still good to have for two reasons:

 - it simplifies recovery if we hit bug #1763322, see[1]
 - it will not cause unexpected issue if we offer the possibility to
   have non-HA l3 agent.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/attachment.cgi?id=1421308

Change-Id: Ibba351ff625abfe8fd5b1f76b9a49bac120cbd8a
Related-Bug: #1763322
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/55/560855/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NeutronAllowL3AgentFailover: True

added_lines: Returns a tuple of the most recent return code (mrrc) and a global flag that indicates any failures had been in the check progress. The latter only indicates when checks executed against the given Heat template file have any failures. While mrrc allows to chain a few checks based on the consequent retval results. has_failures = 0 return (1, 1) has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval has_failures |= retval return (1, 1) return (1, 1) return (retval, has_failures) mrrc, has_failures = validate(file_path, param_map) if mrrc or has_failures: exit_val |= mrrc or has_failures mrrc, has_failures = validate(base_path, param_map) if mrrc or has_failures: exit_val |= mrrc or has_failures
deleted_lines: return 1 return 1 return 1 return retval failed = validate(file_path, param_map) if failed: exit_val |= failed failed = validate(base_path, param_map) if failed: exit_val |= failed

commit_message:
Remove tempest_git_* overrides

Presently, tempest in the integrated build is installed from PyPI, but without
constraints. This means the version installed may not be what is expected (as
we're currently seeing in the stable/pike branch).

This commit removes the tempest_git_* overrides from
playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_testing.yml, which results in
tempest getting installed from PyPI but with constraints applied.

Change-Id: I014201129b4d6b47ec45ff6239287623123a1595

Enable debian-stable testing

We want to make sure our roles / playbooks work on debian-stable too.
Lets start testing them since we have nodes online.

commit_message:
Neutron: Update rootwrap for distros where python2 is the default

This PS updates rootwrap to account for distros where python2 is
the default entrypoint for python 2.7 as opposed to either python
or python2.7.

Change-Id: Ia67768985133242e0aef10bb6ce54028eabfe1cf

commit_message:
Remove Openstack and Ceph packages

As we've switched to containers, it's time to start cleaning up the
packages we install on the overcloud images by default. This change
removes all the openstack and ceph packages from the
overcloud-controller, overcloud-ceph-storage and overcloud-compute
elements.

Change-Id: If67d59385e62fb5f8938295aae108c5dc8bb2795
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: If553ad33bd071792198239bc567c2e06058ebddd
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 23b68a02919b114c261dfa2571c01e33ee30dc3e)

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I4c99449f591dc67f0f5aa906426ea34e944ab2c7

commit_message:
Add action to allow charm to make calls to vault

Add an action which can be run after vault has been manually
initialised and unsealed. The action creates a role that allows
localhost calls.

Change-Id: I042b49248db32e6e9a7814c74d8c25939918d0ce

commit_message:
Switch to using run_once instead of matching the first node only

Ansible allows us to run tasks once so we should use that, also
the service add is not something that has to be necessarily be
done on the first node specifically.

Change-Id: I6826fd89dfa09b8f8567a85e61c2210e8d3f76e1
(cherry picked from commit d5afc9ff8c5d0d9a0948b1b508a16976cf7853fb)

commit_message:
Update requirements to include latest Gabbi change

The gabbi repo was just updated so that the driver.py build_tests()
method will lists tests regardless of whether a host is configured
or reachable. This fixes the bug, but what's left is to ensure that
the new gabbi version is installed when heat-tempest-plugin is
installed.

Change-Id: Id04d56cd519e50bb5c146ce2cdf76d90118f89d4
Closes-Bug: #1749218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-tempest-plugin refs/changes/09/561709/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: gabbi>=1.42.0 # Apache-2.0

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-19 13:04:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-vault/commit/0f7f301fb51dd6e58fb5a84136b3dbb02c720e65', 'message': 'Add suppport for DNS HA

commit_message:
Add suppport for DNS HA

Add support for DNS HA. The config option is different from the
openstack charm config options which use a combination of the
boolean dns-ha and os-*-hostname options. However, vault only
supports one access network space.

Change-Id: I60be68d877a2949831c8a4565ccaa9a3536c8c1b

In order to change the requirements file, we also need to fix the lower

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

In order to change the requirements file, we also need to fix the lower
constraints list so that the values comply with the rules, so this patch
includes those changes as well.

Change-Id: Id503eb40432b5b3502d156e907dd342b536bf33e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Don't StartCase the role name

Start Casing role names causes names mangling for certain roles
e.g. OpenShiftMaster -> Open Shift Master (incorrect name)

Change-Id: Ia5500106bff5e8bdaae9df1e50c9ec1252c395c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ui refs/changes/26/561226/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix gate: PEP8 and ovs-master jobs

This patch is fixing the by:

1. Update code to reflect stricter PEP8 handling

2. Adding a /bin/bash in front of the ovn-ctl commands.

The reason for 2. still unknown to me, perhaps something has changed in
Ubuntu Xenial (it doens't fail on CentOS for example) which was causing
the error below:

$ /usr/local/share/openvswitch/scripts/ovn-ctl --no-monitor start_northd
/usr/local/share/openvswitch/scripts/ovn-ctl: 1: local: -vfile:info: bad
variable name

Backport note:
The original patch in master branch included some hack for OVS. At the
moment of the cherry-pick, OVS was fixed so I removed it in
devstack/lib/networking-ovn.

Change-Id: I9dca4ba494082a0bf37833b13b05609c715a492d
(cherry picked from commit 1af6ea97bbba0b08f63ece59569ebc398a0721a7)

commit_message:
Grafana: Update dashboards

This ps includes the following grafana dashboard changes:

- Renames the OpenStack dashboard title
- Removes redundant kubernetes dashboards
- Fixes datasource for the nginx dashboard
- Fixes templating variable for rabbitmq dashboard

Change-Id: I2fa1ff606746ce1f51d2ed01788bb5282bd53dfc

commit_message:
Prometheus: Update Alertmanager discovery, fix rules entry

Updates the service discovery mechanism used by Prometheus to
identify Alertmanager instances to push alerts to. It moves to
use the 'application' label to identify Alertmanager pods instead of
searching for pods by the label 'name', as the previous definition
was resulting in empty results for Alertmanager targets

This also fixes the name of the prometheus label used to track
alerts for kube-controller-manager, as it was defined incorrect
previously

Change-Id: I1fb194550baf803435722e3a01892e49b44259d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/59/546659/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default: alerts-engine discovery: alertmanager-discovery mesh: default: 6783 - static_configs: - targets: - alertmanager-discovery:9093
deleted_lines: default: alerts-api - kubernetes_sd_configs: - role: pod relabel_configs: - source_labels: - __meta_kubernetes_pod_label_name regex: alertmanager action: keep - source_labels: - __meta_kubernetes_namespace regex: openstack action: keep - source_labels: - __meta_kubernetes_pod_container_port_number regex: action: drop

subject: Only replace python when re-initializing the venv
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-18 10:03:53.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/tempest_install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest/commit/ce9d7ae0b31833037d21c79cf61d60970ba35bcb', 'message': "Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Icf39a1b5057e998d92923026a587ee3fdcb37c13
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Icf39a1b5057e998d92923026a587ee3fdcb37c13
Partial-Bug: #1764470
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/00/562200/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(odyssey4me): # We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right # version of python is in the venv, but we do not # want virtualenv to also replace pip, setuptools # and wheel so we tell it not to. # We do not use --always-copy for CentOS/SuSE due # to https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/issues/565 virtualenv {{ tempest_venv_bin | dirname }} \ {{ (ansible_pkg_mgr == 'apt') | ternary('--always-copy', '') }} \ --no-pip \ --no-setuptools \ --no-wheel

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I5f7e8fd36185537543d0741d88a5ccc9cd1f1645
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit a686b93020ee8ab6dae364864dcb45ffb7255307)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/09/562709/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(odyssey4me): # We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right # version of python is in the venv, but we do not # want virtualenv to also replace pip, setuptools # and wheel so we tell it not to. # We do not use --always-copy for CentOS/SuSE due # to https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/issues/565 virtualenv {{ nova_bin | dirname }} \ {{ (ansible_pkg_mgr == 'apt') | ternary('--always-copy', '') }} \ --no-pip \ --no-setuptools \ --no-wheel

commit_message:
Alert rules in prometheus to support nagios based monitoring via alert metric queries

Change-Id: I425dbc1b33d7dcb1aa20a7b2a22bd6b5adfbfa5a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/00/555700/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - alert: statefulset_replicas_unavailable expr: kube_statefulset_status_replicas < kube_statefulset_replicas for: 5m labels: severity: page annotations: description: 'statefulset {{$labels.statefulset}} has {{$value}} replicas, which is less than desired' summary: '{{$labels.statefulset}}: has inssuficient replicas.' basic_linux: groups: - name: basic_linux.rules rules: - alert: node_filesystem_full_80percent expr: sort(node_filesystem_free{device!="ramfs"} < node_filesystem_size{device!="ramfs"} * 0.2) / 1024 ^ 3 for: 5m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} device {{$labels.device}} on {{$labels.mountpoint}} got less than 10% space left on its filesystem.' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: Filesystem is running out of space soon.' - alert: node_filesystem_full_in_4h expr: predict_linear(node_filesystem_free{device!="ramfs"}[1h], 4 * 3600) <= 0 for: 5m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} device {{$labels.device}} on {{$labels.mountpoint}} is running out of space of in approx. 4 hours' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: Filesystem is running out of space in 4 hours.' - alert: node_filedescriptors_full_in_3h expr: predict_linear(node_filefd_allocated[1h], 3 * 3600) >= node_filefd_maximum for: 20m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} is running out of available file descriptors in approx. 3 hours' summary: '{{$labels.alias}} is running out of available file descriptors in 3 hours.' - alert: node_load1_90percent expr: node_load1 / ON(alias) count(node_cpu{mode="system"}) BY (alias) >= 0.9 for: 1h labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} is running with > 90% total load for at least 1h.' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: Running on high load.' - alert: node_cpu_util_90percent expr: 100 - (avg(irate(node_cpu{mode="idle"}[5m])) BY (alias) * 100) >= 90 for: 1h labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} has total CPU utilization over 90% for at least 1h.' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: High CPU utilization.' - alert: node_ram_using_90percent expr: node_memory_MemFree + node_memory_Buffers + node_memory_Cached < node_memory_MemTotal * 0.1 for: 30m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} is using at least 90% of its RAM for at least 30 minutes now.' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: Using lots of RAM.' - alert: node_swap_using_80percent expr: node_memory_SwapTotal - (node_memory_SwapFree + node_memory_SwapCached) > node_memory_SwapTotal * 0.8 for: 10m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} is using 80% of its swap space for at least 10 minutes now.' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: Running out of swap soon.' - alert: high_cpu_load expr: node_load15 / on(alias) count(node_cpu{mode="system"}) by (alias) >= 0 for: 1m labels: severity: warning annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} is running with load15 > 1 for at least 5 minutes: {{$value}}' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: Running on high load: {{$value}}' - alert: high_memory_load expr: (sum(node_memory_MemTotal) - sum(node_memory_MemFree + node_memory_Buffers + node_memory_Cached)) / sum(node_memory_MemTotal) * 100 > 85 for: 1m labels: severity: warning annotations: description: Host memory usage is {{ humanize $value }}%. Reported by instance {{ $labels.instance }} of job {{ $labels.job }}. summary: Server memory is almost full - alert: high_storage_load expr: (node_filesystem_size{mountpoint="/"} - node_filesystem_free{mountpoint="/"}) / node_filesystem_size{mountpoint="/"} * 100 > 85 for: 30s labels: severity: warning annotations: description: Host storage usage is {{ humanize $value }}%. Reported by instance {{ $labels.instance }} of job {{ $labels.job }}. summary: Server storage is almost full - alert: high_swap expr: (node_memory_SwapTotal - node_memory_SwapFree) < (node_memory_SwapTotal * 0.4) for: 1m labels: severity: warning annotations: description: Host system has a high swap usage of {{ humanize $value }}. Reported by instance {{ $labels.instance }} of job {{ $labels.job }}. summary: Server has a high swap usage - alert: high_network_drop_rcv expr: node_network_receive_drop{device!="lo"} > 3000 for: 30s labels: severity: warning annotations: description: Host system has an unusally high drop in network reception ({{ humanize $value }}). Reported by instance {{ $labels.instance }} of job {{ $labels.job }} summary: Server has a high receive drop - alert: high_network_drop_send expr: node_network_transmit_drop{device!="lo"} > 3000 for: 30s labels: severity: warning annotations: description: Host system has an unusally high drop in network transmission ({{ humanize $value }}). Reported by instance {{ $labels.instance }} of job {{ $labels.job }} summary: Server has a high transmit drop - alert: high_network_errs_rcv expr: node_network_receive_errs{device!="lo"} > 3000 for: 30s labels: severity: warning annotations: description: Host system has an unusally high error rate in network reception ({{ humanize $value }}). Reported by instance {{ $labels.instance }} of job {{ $labels.job }} summary: Server has unusual high reception errors - alert: high_network_errs_send expr: node_network_transmit_errs{device!="lo"} > 3000 for: 30s labels: severity: warning annotations: description: Host system has an unusally high error rate in network transmission ({{ humanize $value }}). Reported by instance {{ $labels.instance }} of job {{ $labels.job }} summary: Server has unusual high transmission errors - alert: node_network_conntrack_usage_80percent expr: sort(node_nf_conntrack_entries{job="node-exporter"} > node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{job="node-exporter"} * 0.8) for: 5m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.instance}} has network conntrack entries of {{ $value }} which is more than 80% of maximum limit' summary: '{{$labels.instance}}: available network conntrack entries are low.' - alert: node_entropy_available_low expr: node_entropy_available_bits < 300 for: 5m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.instance}} has available entropy bits of {{ $value }} which is less than required of 300' summary: '{{$labels.instance}}: is low on entropy bits.' - alert: node_hwmon_high_cpu_temp expr: node_hwmon_temp_crit_celsius*0.9 - node_hwmon_temp_celsius < 0 OR node_hwmon_temp_max_celsius*0.95 - node_hwmon_temp_celsius < 0 for: 5m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} reports hwmon sensor {{$labels.sensor}}/{{$labels.chip}} temperature value is nearly critical: {{$value}}' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: Sensor {{$labels.sensor}}/{{$labels.chip}} temp is high: {{$value}}' - alert: node_vmstat_paging_rate_high expr: irate(node_vmstat_pgpgin[5m]) > 80 for: 5m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} has a memory paging rate of change higher than 80%: {{$value}}' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: memory paging rate is high: {{$value}}' - alert: node_xfs_block_allocation_high expr: 100*(node_xfs_extent_allocation_blocks_allocated_total{job="node-exporter", instance=~"172.17.0.1.*"} / (node_xfs_extent_allocation_blocks_freed_total{job="node-exporter", instance=~"172.17.0.1.*"} + node_xfs_extent_allocation_blocks_allocated_total{job="node-exporter", instance=~"172.17.0.1.*"})) > 80 for: 5m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} has xfs allocation blocks higher than 80%: {{$value}}' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: xfs block allocation high: {{$value}}' - alert: node_network_bond_slaves_down expr: node_net_bonding_slaves - node_net_bonding_slaves_active > 0 for: 5m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{ $labels.master }} is missing {{ $value }} slave interface(s).' summary: 'Instance {{ $labels.instance }}: {{ $labels.master }} missing {{ $value }} slave interface(s)' - alert: node_numa_memory_used expr: 100*node_memory_numa_MemUsed / node_memory_numa_MemTotal > 80 for: 5m labels: severity: page annotations: description: '{{$labels.alias}} has more than 80% NUMA memory usage: {{ $value }}' summary: '{{$labels.alias}}: has high NUMA memory usage: {{$value}}' - commit_message:
Updating time for functional tests

Currenlty, some gates is being failed with logs like this

"""
b'Response: {"description": "Provided object does not match schema
\'Secret\': \'expiration\' is before current time.
Invalid property: \'expiration\'", "title": "Bad Request", "code": 400}'
"""

So it is necessary to update the time to create secrets successfully.

Change-Id: I59707cdf21f6843dbd7db30978e21cff72756e67
(cherry picked from commit af4637bcf2c0cb807fc8392c9e0e5d7d4404d92e)

commit_message:
WIP - Implement logging to file by default

This patch implements logging to ~/undercloud-install.log by default
during containerized undercloud installation.

Change-Id: I62304adb958ea10033fe1e9126cc6730938ebbfe
Related-Bug: 1761552
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/82/562082/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import errnoLOG_FILE = os.path.expanduser('~/install-undercloud.log') DEFAULT_LOG_LEVEL = logging.DEBUG LOG = None def _configure_logging(self, level, filename): try: os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(LOG_FILE)) except OSError as e: if e.errno != errno.EEXIST: raise logging.basicConfig(filename=filename, level=level) global LOG LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) if os.environ.get('OS_LOG_CAPTURE') != '1': handler = logging.StreamHandler() LOG.addHandler(handler) self._configure_logging(DEFAULT_LOG_LEVEL, LOG_FILE) LOG.info('Logging to %s', LOG_FILE)

commit_message:
Switch amphora tarball to ubuntu xenial

Centos Amphora doesn't work properly with L2 configuration as it doesn't
reach its own VIP address. This commit switches the host os to ubuntu until
[1] is fixed.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/1715166

Change-Id: I43047fa4cc03d8c14ccaa7eebab1bdaa69e25360

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Ie71d42836014c2354e252389cc14e52a06b6f062
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 71a7b842472c3333e3736b00e98dfe81bf778a87)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_magnum refs/changes/73/562673/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(odyssey4me): # We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right # version of python is in the venv, but we do not # want virtualenv to also replace pip, setuptools # and wheel so we tell it not to. # We do not use --always-copy for CentOS/SuSE due # to https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/issues/565 virtualenv {{ magnum_bin | dirname }} \ {{ (ansible_pkg_mgr == 'apt') | ternary('--always-copy', '') }} \ --no-pip \ --no-setuptools \ --no-wheel

commit_message:
Added enable_tempest flag for installing tempest on undercloud

* In order to achieve the containerizing tempest goal, we need to
  make sure the tempest fake service is available on the undercloud
  so that it can be used for running tempest tests.

Change-Id: I0dd38ea4ffbe06eb10d7f86a9f87333c193ea398
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/10/558510/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add retries for Dogtag plugin

Some Dogtag gate failures appear to be from memory issues
that show up in NSS.  The Dogtag plugin should be made more
robust by adding a retry mechanism.  Failures from Dogtag should
also be better reported.

Change-Id: I148b1c8e265b327d60d76f88c036b032af014930

commit_message:
Added monitoring tag to monitoring user creation task.

Without that tag, the monitoring user doesn't have the proper privileges
to access the management API to collect metrics. Check the Permission
section in RabbitMQ documentation at https://www.rabbitmq.com/management.html
for futher precision regarding the permission model.

Closes-Bug: 1750582
Change-Id: Iebf279ca591e646656f8411934fd58dc43d5f002
(cherry picked from commit 45cebe81c267951c2ebff07ec371751dc26c2d22)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/21/559321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tags: "monitoring"

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I8f8f2c2eb65a7f48b901aee6506504d725f2e629
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit d78498a1a3a538d6af7bc94356dec0aa11cd6102)

commit_message:
Add (Same|Different)HostFilter to defaults

SameHostFilter and DifferentHostFilter filter hosts according to
scheduler hints. The two filters are needed by many downstream CI
jobs. Instead of every job overriding the enabled filters list, this
patch adds the two filters to the defaults. What's best for CI isn't
necessarily what's best for users - by that logic nova would enable
all of the filters by default like devstack does. However, we need
some filters to be the defaults, so the line has to be drawn
somehwere. Since (Same|Different)HostFilter are harmless, this patch
proposes to put them on the other side of that line.

It also turns out we were incorrectly using the SameHostFilter with
regular expressions instead of a UUID in the same_host scheduler hint.
This is removed in this patch.

Change-Id: I0f4c8d0a0ae539e7d440695ed242a73c469696f8

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Ie968a6ab5f37ed11a5d1b63c09fbdecfc8c33cc1
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 17e57e14a847de9f38342d7c6af6a333a2cc73f7)

commit_message:
Disallow SSLv2, SSLv3 and TLS1.0 in httpd for FedRAMP compliance.

We now enforce TLS1.1 or higher for httpd connections, to meet the
requirements for FedRAMP.

Change-Id: If875822f1cb705d17405621e64fea2536edc142a
Related-Bug: #1754368
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/09/562509/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: apache::mod::ssl::ssl_protocol: ['all', '-SSLv2', '-SSLv3', '-TLSv1']

commit_message:
Improve the deployment confirmation message

The deployment confirmation dialog currently shows a warning message
saying not all pre-deployment validations have passed. This gives the
impression that those validations have failed, even though they have
merely been started when opening the confirmation dialog and haven't
finished yet.

This patch makes it a bit clearer what is actually happening.

Change-Id: I1f72dfcaa02ef5e4a101efc25bf473e0b8909f35

deleted_lines: validationsWarningTitle: { id: 'DeploymentConfirmation.validationsWarningTitle', defaultMessage: 'Not all pre-deployment validations have passed.' }, validationsWarningMessage: { id: 'DeploymentConfirmation.validationsWarningMessage', defaultMessage: 'It is highly recommended that you resolve all validation issues before ' + 'continuing.' title={intl.formatMessage(messages.validationsWarningTitle)} <FormattedMessage {...messages.validationsWarningMessage} />

commit_message:
Reduce verbosity during mysql bootstrap

During the initial deployment, a one-time container is used to bootstrap the
mysql databse on disk, create the required users and set their password. The
script that runs that is too verbose and logs some credentials in the
container's logs and in the journal.

Use kolla_extend_start directly instead of kolla_start to stop tracing shell
commands and reduce logging to the bare minimum for troubleshooting.

Closes-Bug: #1765339

Change-Id: I90827feff0d1b9fd8badb72e68e4c8dd8db8aea5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/07/562807/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - '-ec' - 'kolla_set_configs' - 'sudo -u mysql -E kolla_extend_start'

commit_message:
Enforce linear strategy for orchestrate-devstack

Document that orchestrate-devstack requires a linear strategy in the
invoking play. Also enforce the strategy in devstack.yaml.

Change-Id: Ia081225ec2be959fc5a4ddfd491f526296a8ca10
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/50/561250/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This is the default strategy, however since orchestrate-devstack requires # "linear", it is safer to enforce it in case this is running in an # environment configured with a different default strategy. strategy: linear

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle(2.4.0) update break
neutron-lbaas pep8 job due to the new rules.

This commit fixes the following new errors:
- E501 line too long
- E402 module level import not at top of file
- W503 line break before binary operator

Story: 2001828
Task: 12584

Change-Id: Ifa5a75745bd03aba6af63422623c5cd9eef344e4
(cherry picked from commit fc126428f055ac5fd0ddd6936b90c79e24bfa8e1)

commit_message:
Move heat_launcher data to /var/log/heat-launcher

We don't want to use /var/tmp anymore because we need a place that is
persistent and consistent with other services.

Also, we need to secure the directory because it containers heat sqlite
with passwords.

Depends-On: I60d086dbbd0be409ff78c35ebce3f25b6ba5c908
Change-Id: I50d786cb19536ca6a7cea62cf57466b5302e8a42

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I0aa57fe2c7558cf2ffe9e1bb981036d8728ba42a
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit fbddccd0864de821f0195e40c5b05f38b480c66b)

commit_message:
ovs_lib: add support for OpenFlow 1.5

This change add support for OpenFlow 1.5 for
OVSBridge.use_at_least_protocol().

This will allow, in particular, the use of bucket_id in
Id8f5318746cdee507beb112ba69800a43c7f6f20 .

Change-Id: If8f2374e1bff42ff4b1030bbb17e284f31c6ce45
Needed-By: Id8f5318746cdee507beb112ba69800a43c7f6f20

commit_message:
Switch from debian-jessie to debian-stable (stretch)

Now that we have debian-stretch images online for openstack-infra,
we'd like to remove debian-jessie[1]. This updates zuul jobs to use the
debian-stable label, which happens to now be debian-stretch.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129573.html

Change-Id: I7ea475bbdcde533dfde0a30bb516a5fe3a83cab7
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools with a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Ic37abfb14303b93dfc80398d6e37706a68135cb0
Partial-Bug: #1741634
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 89c616ff32a2cb3f871c291ac8ec69a66745dfe3)

commit_message:
Add gathering of crashed pod logs to post-run job

This ps adds the gathering of previous pod logs to provide a means
for debugging situations where a pod crashes before eventually
succeeding

Change-Id: I26dda14429f7b850951127ab6c9d346a49635bf3

commit_message:
Add python3 functional voting and non-voting jobs

In I4052547b5dc1e70a7fb079dcd13ec2a32d5efefe we're removing the plugins
job from the plugins repo and adding it to tests, this will allow us to
use these jobs for the ansible-config_template repo as well as the
openstack-ansible-plugins repo.

Change-Id: Id6c1bfb4b93e7d37c76c891dc537567d7df0d5c5

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix share size when creating from snapshot

The ONTAP driver was ignoring the size requested when
creating a share from an existing snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1717263
(cherry picked from commit b14d3513db9269447b865ae4b7bd049236f3259b)

Change-Id: I335f72a8dea49d5855201fc63a7ac22240b60bbf

commit_message:
Fix error when /etc/hosts does not exist

Even though this might seem very rare/unusual/non-acceptable
there are cases where the /etc/hosts file does not exist
(or has been moved temporarily). This fix prevents error
from being raised. This furthermore ensure idem-potency
as without the fix, using the role after failure just
works because /etc/hosts has now been created.

Change-Id: Ied4875d4fc6754bb262496e69b231b192166b23c
(cherry picked from commit d5d516ee7c214d09ff5c2ba3eaa2ac92728b4688)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/27/562927/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: changed_when: not stat_hosts.stat.exists or stat_hosts.stat.md5 | string != update_hosts.stdout | string

commit_message:
Fix error when /etc/hosts does not exist

Even though this might seem very rare/unusual/non-acceptable
there are cases where the /etc/hosts file does not exist
(or has been moved temporarily). This fix prevents error
from being raised. This furthermore ensure idem-potency
as without the fix, using the role after failure just
works because /etc/hosts has now been created.

Change-Id: Ied4875d4fc6754bb262496e69b231b192166b23c
(cherry picked from commit d5d516ee7c214d09ff5c2ba3eaa2ac92728b4688)

commit_message:
Add `privileged` SCC to SA in OpenShift DevStack

In containerized OpenShift deployments we're not attaching `privileged`
SCC to `kuryr-controller` SA created by DevStack plugin. This causes
kuryr-controller Deployment and kuryr-cni DaemonSet to fail as
`kuryr-controller` SA lacks permissions to run privileged containers.

This commit solves that by using `oadm` to attach the SCC to SA.

Change-Id: I2c827cd986a17e08c94558c852b4a225cfe057a6
Closes-Bug: 1759287
(cherry picked from commit 08ce5650516f10d1ee1f07f5b3c667c7abb3c6c7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/01/562501/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled openshift-master; then # NOTE(dulek): For OpenShift add privileged SCC to serviceaccount. /usr/local/bin/oadm policy add-scc-to-user privileged -n kube-system -z kuryr-controller fi

commit_message:
Create CNI bin dir in OpenShift DevStack plugin

In case of containerized deployment we haven't been creating
$CNI_BIN_DIR directory. This made containerized deployments with
OpenShift to fail. This commit solves that by adding `mkdir` just before
the directory is needed as OpenShift installation should not depend on
Kuryr installation.

Change-Id: Iea797939fdb8dc6f0db4a4f128075b94f85c8073
Closes-Bug: 1759153
(cherry picked from commit 1ab7e66a82e667cb439404f94cd36b2f328d20c6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/75/563075/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo mkdir -p "$CNI_BIN_DIR"

commit_message:
Add more tags examples to IHA

This commit adds two additional examples about tags, so now we have
concrete examples for either images, flavors and VMs (otherwise these
commands are really hard to find or imagine).

Change-Id: Ib3c245200129faeb2e38a1cc80e66de6ec698b47

commit_message:
Specs rolling upgrades for Heat

Initial spec for rolling upgrades.
- Listed out detail work items in the specification document.
- Listed out detail primary assignee.
- Added assert "assert:supports-rolling-upgrade" tag for Heat.

Co-Authored-By: Kien Nguyen <KienNT@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I1ad3ba54dd3e84583ff7e3e104efc5fa24ab721b
Implements: blueprint heat-rolling-upgrades
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/89/407989/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================ Rolling Upgrades ================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/rolling-upgrades Heat users would be required to upgrade their existing environments while minimising the downtime. This spec outlines the changes required to be able to assert the various upgrade tags. The goal for Ocata is to assert ``assert:supports-rolling-upgrade`` tag. Problem description =================== There are currently four upgrade tags: * ``assert:supports-upgrade`` * ``assert:supports-rolling-upgrade`` * ``assert:supports-zero-downtime-upgrade`` * ``assert:supports-zero-impact-upgrade`` supports-upgrade ---------------- The ``assert:supports-upgrade`` tag has already been asserted for Heat. supports-rolling-upgrade ------------------------ The requirements for asserting the ``assert:supports-rolling-upgrade`` tag are listed in[1]. They are: * The project is already tagged as ``type:service``. * Heat status: done * The project has already successfully asserted the ``assert:supports-upgrade`` tag. * Heat staus: done * The project has a defined plan that allows operators to roll out new code to subsets of services, eliminating the need to restart all services on new code simultaneously. Heat provides two discrete services: api service and heat engine. To ensure a smooth upgrade experience, we need to properly describe the upgrade process for these services. Proposed change =============== Using the simple strategy of 'never remove, never alter, only add', we can ensure a new schema change is understandable by both old and new engines. if required, we can implement an approach similar to the one proposed for glance[2] in the future. Heat rpc api is backward compatible (i.e old api services and old engines can communicate with new engines). However, new engine/api services can not communicate with old engines using the new rpc api. Ensuring that engines/api services with version ``N`` don't communicate with the engines with version ``N+1`` would remove this rpc api incompatibility. This can be implemented by using a different rabbitmq vhost for the upgraded engines and api services. This is possible with only configuration changes at the time of Upgrades. The upgrade path proposed is as below. 1. The database is upgraded using the above mentioned strategies. 2. Create a new rabbitmq vhost for the new release and change the ``transport_url`` in ``heat.conf`` for all upgraded services. ``transport_url = rabbit://<user>:<password>@<host>:5672/<new_vhost>`` 2. An engine service is first taken offline. The new/upgraded engine, can then be started with the new rabbitmq vhost. This would ensure that none of the existing engines and api services would communicate with the new engine. 3. An api service is then upgraded and started with the new rabbitmq vhost. This would ensure that the new api service is only communicating with the new engine. Though this is not required from the api service point of view (as mentioned above), we would need this for the upgraded engines (using the new rabbitmq vhost) to process requests. 4. The above process can be followed till all engines and api services are upgraded. 5. Assuming that the api services are behind a loadbalancer all api services should be able to process requests during the upgrade process. .. note:: Upgrade ordering is important with the database being upgraded first, then engine and api services in sets (One or more engines and api services in that order). This would ensure that there is enough capacity available. The above procedures will be added to OpenStack documentation. Alternatives ------------ 1. oslo.versionedobjects - this seems like overkill and will add processing overhead to each and every sample Data model impact ----------------- Depending on the amount of changes, this may increase the size of the model as we need to capture old and new attributes. We can choose to define a period where we stop supporting attributes from EOL builds. REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Pipeline impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Work Items ---------- * Add the above steps to documentation. * Add testing support - multi-node grenade testing - migration testing[3] Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Dependencies ============ None. [1] https://governance.openstack.org/reference/tags/assert_supports-rolling-upgrade.html [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/331740/ [3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/331740/

commit_message:
Integrate Glare functionality

Add mechanism of using Glare links in Heat templates
and possibly Heat CLI.

blueprint integrate-with-glare

Change-Id: I137fb5f3bc4f4a97d8f960649197f94e6a4ad04d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/39/315439/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Integrate Glare functionality ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/integrate-with-glare Add mechanism of using Glare links to templates, environments and resources in Heat templates. Problem description =================== The main idea is to store template and environment files in storage (like Swift) and Glare will provide access to such files by links. We can use the templates directly through heat commands by providing link to template. But we also should use these links in Heat templates. For example, while we create nested stack. Proposed change =============== 1. Implement mechanism of using Glare links in template. 2. Create tests for new functionality. 3. Add documentation about new functionality. 4. Add some examples to heat-templates. Alternatives ------------ Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: ? (glare api hopefully will be provided in june) Work Items ---------- 1. Implement using of Glare links. 2. Add related tests. 3. Add corresponding docs. 4. Add examples of usage to heat-templates. Dependencies ============

Use glance v2 to manager this new resource lifecycle Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: huangtianhua@huawei.com Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: newton-2 Work Items ---------- * Add resource OS::Glance::ImageMember * Add related tests Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Migrate to use glance v2

Now glance v1 is deprecated, and even in devstack the
default version of glance is v2, this blueprint will migrate
to use glance v2, and will make image resource compatible
with old template.

Change-Id: I80ca7131a705e08925588cb2b92e4a75cd5c8242
Blueprint: migrate-to-glance-v2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/50/240450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================== Migrate to glance v2 ====================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/migrate-to-glance-v2 Migrate to use glance v2, and make template of glance image resource compatible with glance v2. Problem description =================== Now glance v1 is deprecated, and even in devstack the default version of glance is v2, also consider that there are some glance v2 resources which we may want to support in heat, so we will migrate to use glance v2. Proposed change =============== We will migrate to use glance v2, and will to make glance resources(now only one resource: image) compatible with old template. There are two differences between v1 and v2 for image resource: 1. The glance v1 supports to set 'location' in image-create api, but glance v2 provides another location-add api instead. Solution: set the 'location' after an empty image creation. 2. The glance v1 supports to specify whether the image is public when image creation with 'is_public' parameter, glance v2 use 'visibility' parameter instead. Solution: add new property 'visibility', set support status 'deprecated' for property 'is_public', and make the two property mutually exclusive. Alternatives ------------ None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: huangtianhua@huawei.com Milestones ---------- mitaka-1 Work Items ---------- 1. Modify the glance client to v2. 2. Make sure the image resource compatible with old template. 3. Add related tests. Dependencies ============ None
